name: K2-210
scenarioDescription:
The K2-210 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-210 is a star with 0.91 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.85 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

K2-210 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-210 system


K2-210 b

K2-210 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-210 b is 0.47382 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-210 b is 0.819 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, K2-210 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-210, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
